byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Antalya, Turkey, and Peter Baker from Washington. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and PETER BAKER

abstract: Pres Obama quickly provides tactical information to help France bomb Islamic State targets in northern Syria in response to Paris terrorist attacks, but seems reluctant to add American ground troops to mix; senior White House officials say airstrikes, raids and supporting local allies are more effective long-term strategies.
lead_paragraph: Even as the president searched for ways to step up the war against the terrorist group, White House officials again ruled out introducing substantial numbers of American ground troops.

headline.main: ​Supporting France, Obama Loath to Add Troops to ISIS Fight
headline.print_headline: Obama Loath to Add Troops to ISIS Fight

snippet: Even as the president searched for ways to step up the war against the terrorist group, White House officials again ruled out introducing substantial numbers of American ground troops.
